dashboard.headerSubtitle: Have a nice day. The water is in good hands today
dashboard.carouselTitle: Things you should know about your filter

slides.s1: It is essential to replace the filter in your water reuse system every 6 months. This ensures that the water maintains its purity and quality, preventing the accumulation of contaminants and particles that may affect health and the proper functioning of the system.
slides.s2: Monthly cleaning of the internal parts of the system is crucial to prevent the buildup of bacteria, algae, and other microorganisms that may develop over time.
slides.s3: Always use clean and residue-free water to refill your reuse system. Introducing contaminated water or water with solid particles can damage the system and reduce the effectiveness of the reuse process.
slides.s4: It's important to carry out periodic inspections to detect possible leaks, cracks, or damaged components. A well-maintained system prevents water loss and ensures that the reuse process is carried out efficiently.
slides.s5: Place the reuse system in a cool, dry, and shaded area. Continuous exposure to high temperatures can deteriorate plastic materials and shorten the lifespan of the components.
slides.s6: Every three months, it is recommended to carry out a deep cleaning of the system. This involves disassembling key components, thoroughly cleaning them with safe products, and disinfecting to remove any accumulated residues or microorganisms.
